Intervention: Anastrozole (investigative product) 1 mg tablet administered orally once daily and goserelin acetate 3.6 mg/ month deposit injection
Tamoxifen (comparator) 20 mg tablet administered orally once daily and goséréline acetate 3.6 mg/ month deposit injection
Eligibility: Premenopausal women, positive estrogen receptors, aged 20 years and over, with operational and measurable breast cancer who have given their informed consent in writing
Medical history of chemotherapy or endocrine treatment for breast cancer, or with a history of radiation therapy.
Results: The RROB was defined as the percentage of patients with a confirmed CR or PR in the TTI population in the 24 weeks prior to treatment (based on calliper measurement data).

By RECIST criteria (V1.0) and assessed by Calliper: Complete response (CR), elimination of all target lesions; Partial response (PR), >= 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; Overall response (RO) = CR + PR.
Description of the arm/group: Anastrozole (investigative product) 1 mg tablet administered orally once daily and goséréline acetate 3.6 mg/ month deposit injection
Unit of measure: Percentage of participants 70.4
Description of the arm/group: Tamoxifene (comparator) 20 mg tablet administered orally once daily and goséréline acetate 3.6 mg/ month deposit injection
Unit of measure: Percentage of participants 50.5
